intro: Elytranthe sogerensis, commonly known as the Sogerén's elytranthe, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae, which includes plants known for their striking floral displays. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces bright orange or red flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun exposure. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
